metadata.title: AS-Blob-Storage-Add-Domains-to-Zscaler-URL-Category
metadata.description: This playbook will use Azure blob storage to maintain a Zscaler custom URL category of your choice. If the azure blob storage is modified, the Zscaler URL category values will be updated to match.
metadata.prerequisites: 1. A configured Zscaler admin account is needed, along with a username, password, and API token for this account. 2. A Zscaler URL Category is also needed. 3. A Microsoft Azure integration account and Azure key vault containing the Zscaler account password and API token must also be set up. Support for the set up and configuration of each of these items can be found here: https://github.com/Accelerynt-Security/AS-Blob-Storage-Add-Domains-to-Zscaler-URL-Category
postDeployment: Add Azure blob storage steps to logic app and update conditions
Grant the playbook access to the Azure key vault

metadata.description: Enter the name of your Microsoft Integration Account
Enter the URL of your Zscaler org
Enter the name of your Zscaler Custom URL Category
Enter the name of the key vault that stores your Zscaler API key and Zscaler password
Enter the name of the key vault Secret that contains the value of your Zscaler API key
Enter the name of the key vault Secret that contains the value of your Zscaler password

Initialize_variable-_Extracted_Domain_Zs.description: Domains added to Zscaler URL Categories must be prepended with a dot. This will hold the final result of the extracted domain, with a prepended dot, if needed.

inputs.name: Extracted Domain - Remove Path
inputs.value: @{substring(variables('Extracted Domain - Remove Subdomain'), 0, int(indexOf(variables('Extracted Domain - Remove Subdomain'), '/')))}
